text:
How: Bottle.
Where: Sweet & Sour 2016.
Appearance: Clear dark golden colour with no head.
Aroma: Apples, sweet, fruit.
Body: Medium to full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet apples, a bit tart, fruit.

August 20, 2016. Bottle at Sweet & Sour. Thanks for sharing! 
Clear golden with no head. Aroma is sweet and fruity with juicy baked apples, hints of ripe pears, caramel, a touch of vanilla and pineapple.

Taste is sweet fruity and light tart. Finish is light tart, very juicy sweet baked apples, hints of peach and pear, sweet brown sugars. Medium to full bodied, oily texture. 
Great, well balanced sweetness and tartness.

Bottle courtesy of tkrjukoff. Pours deep tiny reddish golden leaving some sticky legs on the glass with a swirl. Smell is heavy fruity with sweet and tart apples, pinepple, star fruit, hay, minerals, moist wood, lemon peal and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, sour and heavy fruity. Mouthfeel is soft, round, oily, tart, tiny boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and sour with mixed sweet and sour apples, pale caramel, raisins, star fruit, minerals, lemon peal and hints of alcohol. Nice dried fruit complexity. Intense and delicious!
A: Deep golden coloured N: Deep red apple flavoured, baked apple T: Sweet candied apple, red apples, marshmallows O: Very sweet and nice balance of sweet and tart! Nice!

Bottle at Sweet & Sour 2016 at Sahtipaja, Sätila. Clear golden color. Overripe apple aroma, yeast notes, grapes, apple juice, vanilla, woody notes. Fruity overripe apples, caramel, grapes, yeast notes, apple juice, red grapes, warming alcohol. Great balance, well hidden alcohol.

Poured from a 375 ml bottle dated 2010. 
Aroma is really nice with great apple character. Some candied notes with great spice character and caramel. Some light alcohol spice. 
Pours a lovely, clear copper gold color with some slightly red hues and no head. No lacing and long legs. 
Flavor is really sweet with some nice caramel and sugar notes. Nice apple character with some spice and hints of other fruits. Some light alcohol spice. Tons of apple character. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with no carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really tasty ice cider. Great sugar and spice notes with lots of apple character. One of the best out there.

A golden ice cider with aroma of sweet apple jam, light acidity, light tropical fruits, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity apple jam, with loads of tropical fruits, light butterscotch, alcohol warmth, beautiful and delicious. Bottle at Mondial des Cidres 2016.

Corked bottle, Millesime 2010Light amber color. Deep aroma of caramel and concentrated apple juice, lively. Very sweet, yet not too syrupy; concentrated apple juice dominates the flavor, a bit of caramel, with a high degree of acidity, and ending like a good caramelized tarte tatin. Components are getting stronger, for a bold and long final.Less complex than the best ones, but still wonderful.

Bottle of the 2010 edition split with my wife, $35/375ml and entirely worth it. Pours a clear tawny amber, sticks to the glass with long legs. Soft acid, big apple caramel, a hint of vanilla, honeyed tropical fruit. Medium bodied, big sweet caramel, soft acid, warming alcohol. Soft acid, warm and sweet, a bit of tartness, sweet caramel and apple. Gorgeous, lingering acid, soft apple. Incredibly well balanced and absolutely lovely.

2010 vintage. 375mL bottle, pours a clear bronze with no head. Nose is super complex, with caramelized apple, treacle toffee, almond essence, and low-medium sweetness for an ice cider. Flavour is super complex as well, with notes of almond, caramel, treacle toffee and brown sugar. Fair amount of alcohol heat that is well-situated, with medium sweetness. Elegant and complex. Phenomenal stuff.

Bottle - Cooked apple and some peel with some interesting stone fruit. Clear gold. Such wonderful tropical notes and only the lightest amount of cooked apple. Brilliantly unique and different with little apple.
Nice golden clear. Aroma is apples, oak. Sweet to start on the palate with a seemingly contradictory dry finish due to some woody astringency. Taste is apples, oak, baked apple. Yum.

Généreuse dégustation sur place. Quel endroit magnifique et tout un accueil de cette dame passionnée et, bien évidement, fière de ses produits. Version 2010 en premier lieu. Magnifique robe dorée ou presque orangée. Somptueuses traces de la viscosité du liquide sur mon verre. Richissimes parfums de compote fruitée avec des ananas, des pommes, des poires, des pêches et autres fruits qui méchappent. Beau coussin sucré, rembourré par le caramel, le miel et la vanille sur un alcool qui possède une personnalité boisée. Sur les papilles, cest la fête. Une confiture de fruits chargée par les sucres, timidement bordé par une belle acidité et révélatrice dun séjour en barrique. Au palais, je perçois un corps bien rond avec une texture presque sirupeuse et légèrement collante. En finale, les fruits sont explosifs, jouant les cartes du sucre et de lacidité dune main de maître. Fantastique création. (Vintage 2010 : 10/4/9/4/18). Vintage 2011 en deuxième service. Encore une fois, généreux verre servi sur place : il faut le souligner. Donc, au nez, arômes boisés avec un alcool plus visible. Au goût, saveurs plus sèches, plus vives en alcool, en acidité et en notes boisées. Très bon mais moins décadent que la version 2010. (Vintage 2011 : 8/4/8/4/16)

sample. bright burnt orange with some mean long legs sticking. deep caramelized baked apples, strawberries - wild sweet ones; melons, smooth woodsy oaky notes- gently astringent, orange zest/skin - some of its (and on-the-spot) tartness, grandmas unique (non-reproducible) spices blend. flat carbonation, medium-full body - oily; very lightly tart, woodsy astringent, sweet and spicy finish. most happily confused - blowed my mind actually.

Sample.
Pours deep golden with no head. Nice legs. Aroma is of apples, pear. Taste is of apples, pears, sugar, apple skin, some slight tartness. Palate: Warming alcohol. Full bodied. No carbonation. Slightly sticky. Overall: Surprisingly drinkable. Outstanding. Complex. Serious. Kind of sad I lost a bit of my sample by spitting it on my screen while reading a Czar "rating"TM.

2 oz sample, 2010 vintage. Deep clear amber pour. Aroma is quite rich, old apples, pineapple, apricot, funky-delicious overripe fruit aromas, natural dried fruits, light nutty notes, pecan. Taste is sweet, mouth coating, rich fruity pineapple flavor, caramel, vanilla cake, lots of honey. Palate is completely mouth coating, long lingering syrupy mouthfeel. Very nice.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2015 Sample at the cidery and 2 oz sample from bottle (375 ml) at home. 2010 harvest. 

Appearance: Deep orangey-golden wih impressive legs. 

Aroma: Nice fruity mix of pears, cooked apples and apricots along mild spiciness, light smokey presence, brown sugar and a touch of alcohol.

Taste: Very sweet with a nice acidic presence to balance the sweetness, both caramel and brown sugar, cooked apples, pears, iodine notes, oak, tobacco notes, light spiciness, a touch of alcohol and mild apricots presence... extremely complex! 

Palate: Full body. Thick and syrupy mouthfeel. A bit oily as well. Fruity finish with a pleasant warming presence and mouth coating sweetness (but again, well balanced by the acidity). 

Overall: World-class Ice Cider! Unique because of the mild and really well integrated smokey presence. Incredibly complex with a nice fruity touch (and not only apples, but pears and apricots) and superb balance. A masterpiece! 

Note: I also sampled the 11 harvest at the cidery side-by-side with the 10 and while it was still pretty good it was nowhere nearly as complex and unique as the 10.

Bottle thanks to GT, 2010 vintage. Pours a clear deep golden color. Youthful nose of fresh pear and apple, going to a sugared apple slice and apricot jam. The palate is elegant without being overweight, no yeast funk that I find to be present in many cidre de glace. Flavors of golden apples, apricot, acid, light oak, and hints of sweet spice. Outstanding.

Shared with GT2 on my birthday weekend in SB. Purchased originally at Cidrerie Minot- this was a crazy ice cider that we sampled so we got a 2010 vintage to go. Clear light orange in the matching stemware. Apple danish/strudel dessert aroma. Thick, sweet apple pie in the beginning with crisp, firm tartness to balance. Complex blend of sweet and sour play. Sipper...easy drinking dessert cider.
Bottle thanks GT2, gold pour white head, nose and taste are apple cider sweet, boozy, candy

[ Bottle ][ 375mL ][ Cidrerie du Minot ][ $35 CAD ][ Neige Stemware ][ 2.20.15 ]
>> Minot des Glaces, Vintage 2010. When we sampled this ice cider at the cidrerie, the sample was Maderized and savory. Really odd, but we liked it. It was from an already opened bottle. This fresh bottle was nothing like that, for the better probably. Pours a deep crystal clear orange pour. Big legs. Nose is salty baked apple pie, mild red apple, crisp and fresh. Taste is outstanding- sweet, salty, sour, mild tannic oak balance. Neutral all around and refreshing, never sticky. Ridiculous that it is 5 years old. The front palate is more on the sweet side, but the balance between tannin, acid, and salt makes this an incredible dessert cider.

Bottle @ Mondial des Cidres de Glace 2015. Clear bright golden orange color. Great nose on this. Fresh strawberry and pear. Some apple, vanilla, and a touch of stone fruit preserves. Intense. There is a great sweetness of jammy cooked strawberry and apple. Cotton candy, vanilla, and caramel apple. Light, but sufficient, acidity. Solid. One of the standouts.

Bottle sampled at Mondial 2015 in Montreal with Linh, Ken and Nica. Pours a still, bright Amber-orange body. Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with notes of bright dank fruits, sweet pie, baked apple crisp. Sweet sugar on the palate throughout. This was one of my favorites throughout the entire fest and definitely one of the best ice ciders I hadnt ever tried before.

Ce cidre de glace me semble plus foncé que que certains, mais cest tout aussi lumineux. De bonnes grosses pommes bien mûres et bien froides avec des parfums floraux assez charmants. Les saveurs sont apportées par une texture suave et langoureuse qui imprègne la bouche de particularités aussi intenses que diverses. On y retrouve la pomme dans toute sa splendeur et de plusieurs variétés.. Un léger picotement bien agréable, des pointes poivrées, des moments surets et acidulés qui sallongent en arrière-goût nous rappellent que nous avons la confirmation quon déguste un produit des plus fins et réussis. Récolte dhiver 2010 (1347-121214)

[5249-20130425] Bottle. Light apple floral aroma. Clear, light yellow white body with quick white bubbles. Flavour is like icing sugar apples. Medium body. Tasty, quite sweet. (7/3/8/3/15) 3.6
(@ cidery, Hemmingford, QC)

2013-04-25. Sweet apple in aroma, notes of apple must and skins. 7+ Flavour is quite sweet up front, sugars, caramel and apple, but finishes with a very pleasant acidity. Light alcohol presence. Full bodied syrupy palate. 4+ Quite nice, I found this slightly more complex than the Minot des Glaces, but I almost prefer the regular Minot des Glaces in some ways. Bottle, sampled at the cidery
